definition: to come apart
to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from
see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]
festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: And if you thought there was an intellectual/emotional disconnect before, wait till you see this thing.
sentences.chinese: 如果你以前认为这里有什么脱节的话，等着瞧。

sentences.english: Their risk-assessment and security-management skills are failing to keep up.
sentences.chinese: 他们的风险评估和安全管理出现脱节。

sentences.english: You have a sense of meaning, rather than a disjointed series of tasks.
sentences.chinese: 你拥有了内涵，并不再拥有一系列脱节的任务。

sentences.english: I feel disconnected from other people and from my life.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得和其他人，和我的生活都脱节了。

sentences.english: There are some repetition and disjunction in this poem; I suspected there might be some errors in it.
sentences.chinese: 诗中重复脱节，疑有错误。

sentences.english: In some ways Freeman seems out of phase with modernity.
sentences.chinese: 从某些方面看，弗里曼似乎与现代生活有些脱节。

sentences.english: Are We Disconnecting From Real Life?
sentences.chinese: 我们与真实生活脱节了吗？

sentences.english: Itas ten years since Arabdominingella swan left me.
sentences.chinese: 阿里贝拉脱节我有十年了。

sentences.english: When I ra stronggand Jim hcl post typicficpretty much ingly left.
sentences.chinese: 我打电话的工夫，吉姆就已经脱节了。

sentences.english: There's a disconnect between big brands and their customers.
sentences.chinese: 大品牌及其消费者之间存在脱节。

sentences.english: The discussion method is time - consuming and tangental.
sentences.chinese: 那种讨论方法既浪费时间又与正题脱节。

sentences.english: Chinese painting got adrift frome the realism through the Qing and Ming dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 经过明清两代的发展，中国绘画愈加与现实脱节。

sentences.english: Already "the poults " schedule was out of joint by several hours.
sentences.chinese: 这些小火鸡的装运日程已经脱节了好几个小时。

sentences.english: The theory of China's Professional Accreditation of Public Relations Practitioners are divorced from the reality.
sentences.chinese: 我国公关员职业认证的理论与现实有脱节。

sentences.english: Regulators and supervisors of financial institutions were no longer grounded in reality.
sentences.chinese: 监管和监督机构的政策行动与现实脱节。

sentences.english: "the poults" schedule was out of joint by several hours.
sentences.chinese: 这些小火鸡的装运日程已经脱节了好几个小时。

definition: to lag behind
to be ahead of one's time/to surpass or outdo one's predecessors/to be ahead of the pack/to take the lead/advanced
to catch up with/to keep pace with
(idiom) terribly busy/up to one's ears in work
to fall behind the ranks/to be outdated
to cut apart/to sever/to separate/to isolate
to become rigid
to run in the opposite direction (idiom); to run counter to
lit. to attend to one thing and lose sight of another (idiom)/fig. to be unable to manage two or more things at once/cannot pay attention to one thing without neglecting the other
uncoordinated/disharmony
not knowing which course to follow (idiom); at a loss what to do
to lack/to be short of/lack/shortage
stuck and not moving forward (idiom); stagnant/in a rut/at a standstill
railtrack connection/to integrate into sth/to dock/to connect/to be in step with/to bring into line with/to align
to converge
lit. to build a cart behind closed doors/to be overly subjective and disregard the outside world (idiom)
